summary: This document is an email chain from April 4, 2019, between Assistant U.S. Attorney Alex and Edward Tyrrell, requesting travel approval for federal prosecutors to conduct meetings and interviews in Florida related to the investigation United States v. Epstein (2018R01618), concerning the enticement of minors for sexual activity.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: The sender of the email requesting travel approval for the Epstein investigation; appears to be a federal prosecutor with the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.role: U.S. Attorney Office Employee (likely supervisor/approving official)
persons.context: Recipient of the travel approval requests; addressed as 'Ed' in the emails, likely holds a supervisory or administrative role within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Mentioned by Alex as a colleague who would also be traveling to Florida for the Epstein investigation meetings and interviews.

connections.description: Alex is requesting travel approval from Edward Tyrrell, indicating a supervisor-subordinate or administrative reporting relationship within the U.S. Attorney's Office.
Alex and Alison are colleagues traveling together for the same investigation, indicating they are part of the same prosecutorial team.

events.title: Travel for Investigation Meetings in Florida
events.description: Prosecutors Alex and Alison plan to travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for approximately three days to conduct meetings and interviews related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Previous Travel Request for Investigation
events.description: An earlier travel request (March 14, 2019) indicated plans for travel to West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for two days of meetings and interviews for the same case.

locations: Southern District of New York (likely New York, NY)
keyFacts: The document confirms active federal investigation (United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618) into enticement of minors for sexual activity was ongoing in April 2019.
Prosecutors from the Southern District of New York were traveling to Florida for in-person meetings and interviews, indicating coordination or evidence gathering in that state.
The email chain shows internal administrative processes (travel approvals) within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the high-profile Epstein case.
